<!-- Visualizing -->



## Visualizing

### &nbsp; 

```{r, echo=FALSE}
# Create a paycheck item
paycheck <- create_item( name = "Paycheck"
                       , amount = 1000
                       , day = 1
                       , recurring = TRUE
                       )
# Create a rent item
rent <- create_item( name = "Rent"
                   , amount = -500
                   , day = 5
                   , recurring = TRUE
                   )
# Create an internet item
internet <- create_item( name = "Internet"
                       , amount = -100
                       , day = 15
                       , recurring = TRUE
                       )
car <- create_item( name = "Car"
                  , amount = -100
                  , day = "last"
                  , recurring = TRUE
                  )
groceries <- create_item( name = "Groceries"
                  , amount = -100
                  , day = "last"
                  , recurring = TRUE
                  )
my_schedule <- create_schedule(get_items())
my_budget <- create_budget( my_schedule
                          , start = as.Date("2016-09-13")
                          , end = as.Date("2016-12-13")
                          , initial=1000
                          )
my_budget
```

## Visualizing

```{r, echo=FALSE}
plot(my_budget)
```



<!-- Quick Start Hints -->



## Quick start hints

### &nbsp;

- `get_items()` for grabbing all of your items in the current environment
- Save R scripts and/or objects to keep reusing in the future
- `update_*` functions to quickly update your budget objects
